alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knott; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 17 at 3:51PM EST until February 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For most valley locations, expect south to southwest winds of 15 to 25 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph this evening. At higher elevations south of Highway 80 and the Hal Rogers Parkway, winds will gust up to 60 mph. The strongest winds are expect along and just ahead of a line of strong showers and thunderstorms. * WHERE...Knott, Perry, Clay and Leslie Counties. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...High winds could blow down trees and impact power lines. Scattered to widespread power outages are possible. Travel may be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles on west to east oriented roads.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
